top_categories.workout_context: 186 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Jeroboam's mixed terrain forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 186 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Jeroboam's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before July.
23,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 186 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
At Jeroboam, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Jeroboam, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
23,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
124ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
186 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on mixed terrain. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Jeroboam. Train it until it feels boring.

race_overlay.heat: July in Erbusco, Lombardy, Italy can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Jeroboam. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 186 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 186 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Jeroboam. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Jeroboam demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed terrain at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 186 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 186 miles of mixed terrain in Erbusco, Lombardy, Italy.
